Module com.bytefacets.collections
Package com.bytefacets.collections.store

Class ShortChunkMatrixStore

java.lang.Object
com.bytefacets.collections.store.ShortChunkMatrixStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShortMatrixStore
public final class ShortChunkMatrixStore extends Object implements ShortMatrixStore
A matrix store for short values which are stored in array "chunks". Using chunks is especially beneficial for resizing because only new chunks need to be allocated and the copying is at the chunk level.

  • Constructor Details

    • ShortChunkMatrixStore

      public ShortChunkMatrixStore(int initialSize, int chunkSize, int numFields)
      Parameters:
      initialSize - the initial size of the store in terms of the number of groups of fields; though depending on the chunkSize, you may see your initialSize larger than requested; minimum valid value is 1
      chunkSize - the size of the arrays used internally which impact data locality and growth. minimum value is 2, and given values will be rounded up to the next power of 2
      numFields - the number of logical fields in the store; minimum valid value is 1

  • Method Details

    • getShort

      public short getShort(int row, int field)
      Returns the value at the given row and field. If the row is beyond the capacity of the store, it will return the short default value. The field should be within the numFields that the store was instantiated with.
      Specified by:
      getShort in interface ShortMatrixStore
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the row is negative or if the calculated array index is beyond the bounds.
      RangeCheckException - if the field is not within [0, numFields]

    • setShort

      public void setShort(int row, int field, short value)
      Sets the value at the given row and field, growing the store if necessary.
      Specified by:
      setShort in interface ShortMatrixStore
      Throws:
      RangeCheckException - if the field is not within [0, numFields)

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      The current full row capacity of the store.
